Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "There once was a hero named Ragnar the Red, who came riding to Whiterun from ole Rorikstead!"
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage anywhere in the world
Condition: the Player is not a Khajiit

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You ever met one of them cats? - kah-jeet, I think they call themselves. I hear there's whole countries full of them down south."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage anywhere in the world
Condition: the Player is not a Khajiit

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Ever been to Markarth? Some say it was built by the dwarves. I don't believe a word of it though."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Markath
Condition: the Player has not visited Markarth before

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "If you don't mind a piece of advice, I'd stay out of trouble in Markarth. They'll toss you in the Cidhna Mine, and you'll never get out."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Markath

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You'll want to watch out for the Forsworn if you do any travelling around the Reach. Bloodthirsty bastards, them."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Markath

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You picked quite a day for a trip to Markarth."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Markath

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "If you've never been to Riften, be sure to visit the Black-Briar meadery. A few mugs of that and you'll forget all about the long trip."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Riften
Condition: the Player has not visited Riften before

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You'll want to watch yourself in Riften. A lot of ways to get yourself in trouble in that town."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Riften

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "I might have to stop and get myself a pint of Black-Briar mead while I'm in Riften. Almost worth the trip all by itself."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Riften

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You might run into some of them lizard-folk in Riften. Quite a few of them work the docks there, not sure why. Like swimming in the lake, maybe."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Riften
Condition: the Player is not an Argonian

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "I swear it rains like this every time I go to Riften."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Riften

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "First time to Solitude? Beautiful old city. Capital of Skyrim, but I'm sure you already knew that."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Solitude
Condition: the Player has not visited Solitude before

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Solitude's famous for it's Bards College. Worth a visit if you've never been. Some of them can sing just as pretty as a lark."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Solitude

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Solitude's a big port town, you know? Full of sailors and their tales of far away lands. Most of 'em's foreigners and liars, of course."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Solitude

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You picked quite a day for a trip to Solitude."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Solitude

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Never been to Whiterun before? The Jarl's palace is something to see. Dragonsreach they call it. Big old dragon skull hanging on the wall."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Whiterun
Condition: the Player has not visited Whiterun before

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "When I'm in Whiterun, I always visit the Gildergreen. Never hurts to pay your respects to Lady Kynareth, particularly in my line of work."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Whiterun

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "I bet you'll be glad to get to Whiterun and get out of this weather."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Whiterun

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Ever been to Windhelm? Oldest city in Skyrim, by some accounts. They say the big old palace there was built by Ysgramor himself."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Windhelm
Condition: the Player has not  visited Windhelm before

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Windhelm's a bit cold for my tastes. And I ain't talking about the weather. You're not from Windhelm, are you?"
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Windhelm

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "You'll find Windhelm's full of dark elves. The kind from Morrowind, you know. Not that I have anything against them, long as they keep to themselves."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Windhelm
Condition: the Player is not a Dark Elf

Speaker: Carriage Driver
Dialogue: "Better get used to it. Snows most all the time in Windhelm."
Event: the Player is riding a Carriage in Windhelm
